name: Chocolate Lava Cake
preparation: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 220°C (425°F) and grease ramekins with butter.
Step 2: Melt dark chocolate and butter together in a double boiler.
Step 3: In a separate bowl, whisk sugar and eggs until light and fluffy.
Step 4: Add the melted chocolate mixture to the egg mixture and mix well.
Step 5: Fold in flour and vanilla extract until just combined.
Step 6: Pour the batter into the prepared ramekins, filling them about 3/4 full.
Step 7: Bake for 10-12 minutes until the edges are set but the center is still soft.
Step 8: Remove from the oven and let them cool for 1-2 minutes.
Step 9: Invert the ramekins onto plates and serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

name: Tiramisu
preparation: Step 1: Brew strong espresso coffee and let it cool.
Step 2: Separate egg yolks and whites. Whisk yolks with sugar until creamy.
Step 3: Add mascarpone cheese to the yolk mixture and mix until smooth.
Step 4: Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form and fold them into the mascarpone mixture.
Step 5: Dip ladyfingers into the cooled espresso and layer them in a dish.
Step 6: Spread a layer of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers.
Step 7: Repeat the layers, finishing with a mascarpone layer on top.
Step 8: Dust the top with cocoa powder and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
Step 9: Serve chilled and enjoy!

name: Cheesecake
preparation: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 160°C (325°F) and prepare a springform pan.
Step 2: Crush graham crackers and mix with melted butter to form the crust.
Step 3: Press the crust mixture into the bottom of the pan and bake for 10 minutes.
Step 4: Beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth, then add eggs one at a time.
Step 5: Mix in vanilla extract and pour the filling over the crust.
Step 6: Bake for 50-60 minutes until the center is set but slightly wobbly.
Step 7: Turn off the oven and let the cheesecake cool inside with the door slightly open.
Step 8: Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.
Step 9: Serve chilled with fruit toppings or caramel sauce.

name: Brownies
preparation: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a baking pan with parchment paper.
Step 2: Melt dark chocolate and butter together in a double boiler.
Step 3: Whisk sugar and eggs until light and fluffy, then add the chocolate mixture.
Step 4: Sift in flour and cocoa powder, and mix until just combined.
Step 5: Add vanilla extract and pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Step 6: Bake for 25-30 minutes until a toothpick inserted comes out with moist crumbs.
Step 7: Let the brownies cool completely in the pan before cutting.
Step 8: Serve with a dusting of powdered sugar or a scoop of ice cream.

name: Macarons
preparation: Step 1: Sift almond flour and powdered sugar together to remove lumps.
Step 2: Beat egg whites until foamy, then gradually add granulated sugar until stiff peaks form.
Step 3: Gently fold the almond flour mixture into the egg whites until the batter is smooth.
Step 4: Add food coloring if desired and pipe the batter onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Step 5: Tap the baking sheet to release air bubbles and let the macarons rest for 30 minutes.
Step 6: Preheat the oven to 150°C (300°F) and bake the macarons for 15-18 minutes.
Step 7: Let them cool completely before removing from the baking sheet.
Step 8: Sandwich the macarons with your choice of filling (e.g., ganache, buttercream).
Step 9: Serve and enjoy!

name: Panna Cotta
preparation: Step 1: Bloom gelatin in water and set aside.
Step 2: Heat heavy cream and sugar in a saucepan until the sugar dissolves.
Step 3: Remove from heat and add vanilla extract and bloomed gelatin, stirring until dissolved.
Step 4: Pour the mixture into ramekins or molds and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
Step 5: Once set, dip the molds in warm water to loosen and invert onto plates.
Step 6: Top with fresh berries or a fruit coulis.
Step 7: Serve chilled and enjoy!

name: Fruit Tart
preparation: Step 1: Mix flour, butter, sugar, and egg yolks to form a dough for the tart shell.
Step 2: Press the dough into a tart pan and bake at 180°C (350°F) until golden brown.
Step 3: Let the tart shell cool completely.
Step 4: Prepare custard and spread it evenly over the cooled tart shell.
Step 5: Arrange assorted fruits on top of the custard in a decorative pattern.
Step 6: Brush the fruits with a glaze (e.g., apricot jam) for a shiny finish.
Step 7: Serve chilled and enjoy!

name: Mousse
preparation: Step 1: Melt dark chocolate in a double boiler and let it cool slightly.
Step 2: Whip heavy cream until soft peaks form and set aside.
Step 3: Separate egg yolks and whites. Whisk yolks with sugar until creamy.
Step 4: Fold the melted chocolate into the yolk mixture, then gently fold in the whipped cream.
Step 5: Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form and fold them into the mixture.
Step 6: Spoon the mousse into serving glasses and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Step 7: Serve chilled with whipped cream or chocolate shavings on top.

name: Gulab Jamun
preparation: Step 1: Mix milk powder, flour, and ghee to form a dough, adding milk as needed.
Step 2: Shape the dough into small, smooth balls.
Step 3: Heat ghee in a pan and fry the balls on low heat until golden brown.
Step 4: Prepare sugar syrup by boiling sugar, water, cardamom, and rose water.
Step 5: Soak the fried balls in the warm sugar syrup for at least 1 hour.
Step 6: Serve warm or at room temperature, garnished with chopped nuts if desired.

name: Apple Pie
preparation: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 190°C (375°F) and prepare a pie dish with the bottom crust.
Step 2: Peel and slice apples, then toss them with sugar, cinnamon, and flour.
Step 3: Fill the pie crust with the apple mixture and dot with butter.
Step 4: Cover with the top crust, seal the edges, and cut slits for ventilation.
Step 5: Bake for 45-50 minutes until the crust is golden and the filling is bubbly.
Step 6: Let the pie cool before serving with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

name: Churros
preparation: Step 1: Heat water, butter, and a pinch of salt in a saucepan until boiling.
Step 2: Add flour and stir vigorously until the mixture forms a ball.
Step 3: Remove from heat and let it cool slightly, then beat in eggs one at a time.
Step 4: Transfer the dough to a piping bag fitted with a star tip.
Step 5: Heat oil in a pan and pipe the dough into hot oil, cutting with scissors.
Step 6: Fry until golden brown, then drain on paper towels.
Step 7: Toss the churros in a mixture of sugar and cinnamon.
Step 8: Serve warm with chocolate dipping sauce.

name: Ice Cream Sundae
preparation: Step 1: Scoop vanilla ice cream into a serving bowl.
Step 2: Drizzle chocolate sauce over the ice cream.
Step 3: Top with whipped cream and a cherry.
Step 4: Sprinkle with nuts and sprinkles for added texture and flavor.
Step 5: Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Baklava
preparation: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) and butter a baking dish.
Step 2: Layer phyllo dough sheets in the dish, brushing each layer with melted butter.
Step 3: Mix chopped walnuts, sugar, and cinnamon for the filling.
Step 4: Spread the filling over the phyllo layers and continue layering with more phyllo sheets.
Step 5: Cut the baklava into diamond or square shapes before baking.
Step 6: Bake for 30-35 minutes until golden brown.
Step 7: Prepare a syrup with honey, sugar, and water, and pour it over the hot baklava.
Step 8: Let it cool completely before serving.

name: Rice Pudding
preparation: Step 1: Cook rice in water until tender, then drain.
Step 2: Heat milk in a saucepan and add the cooked rice.
Step 3: Stir in sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla extract, and cook until thickened.
Step 4: Add raisins and let the pudding cool slightly.
Step 5: Serve warm or chilled, sprinkled with cinnamon on top.

name: Tres Leches Cake
preparation: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) and prepare a baking dish.
Step 2: Beat eggs and sugar until fluffy, then fold in flour to make the cake batter.
Step 3: Bake the cake for 25-30 minutes until golden and a toothpick comes out clean.
Step 4: Mix milk, condensed milk, and evaporated milk to make the tres leches mixture.
Step 5: Poke holes in the cooled cake and pour the tres leches mixture over it.
Step 6: Refrigerate the cake for at least 2 hours to absorb the milk.
Step 7: Top with whipped cream and serve chilled.
